# UIButton.Configuration.MacIdiomStyle

**Enumeration**

The button style your app uses when running in macOS.

## Declaration

```swift
enum MacIdiomStyle
```

## Overview

If you build your app with [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/mac-catalyst], you can use these styles to configure how your app displays a button when running on a Mac. To opt in to these styles, choose Optimize Interface for Mac in you project’s general settings.

If you’re configuring your button in Interface Builder, you can choose a style from the Mac Style pop-up menu in the Attributes inspector.

## Button styles

- **UIButton.Configuration.MacIdiomStyle.automatic**: The button has a style that matches other content in the button configuration.
- **UIButton.Configuration.MacIdiomStyle.bordered**: The button has a bordered style.
- **UIButton.Configuration.MacIdiomStyle.borderless**: The button has a borderless style.
- **UIButton.Configuration.MacIdiomStyle.borderlessTinted**: The button has a tinted, borderless style.

## Configuring the appearance on macOS

- **macIdiomStyle**: The style to use when this button appears in macOS.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
